Description: Body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck amphora or trefoil-mouth oinochoe; white slip; exterior: painted decoration consisting of two hares (head, neck with added purple, chest and one foreleg of first hare and part of rump of second hare), both to right.
Curator's comments: The rectangular patch behind the hare’s neck is the trace of a label. Unusually, the hare's head is depicted reserved and not in silhouette. For parallels regarding the subject matter, see British Museum 1888,0208.49 from Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (9, no. 8)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 244, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.050)
